course.subject: ENVR
course.name: Urban Air Pollution
course.description: The course is aimed at providing students with insights in how to deal with environmental problems and the way in which science interfaces with policies. It will cover major topics on the sources of air pollutions, air chemistry, oxidation of organic compounds and issues on control of air pollutant emissions and air quality management.

reviews.author: KKKKK
reviews.title: 都幾肯定會爛grade
reviews.comment_content:
Homework1-3 (其實姐係online quiz)各佔10%
Homework 4 (mini-project) 20％
Online reading quiz before class (total 13個) 共20%
Final Exam 30%
基本上每次reading quiz至少要睇兩篇佢提供既academic research article去答問題。本身唔熟悉environmental science就會好迷茫，完全睇唔明篇論文。
Homework同reading quiz 都有3次attempt，但做完又無disclose個分又唔知錯邊題，姐係等於撞多兩次答案。
reviews.comment_teaching:
可能同其他review既分別係因為唔同人教
又悶，又難，0交流
三個鐘堂基本就係對住ppt一直講
內容頗深插不上嘴
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading不透明，除左頭三次reading quiz有grade睇之外，其餘都無
Absolute Grading System
≥ 93, A+; ≥ 90 and <93, A;  ≥ 87 and <90, A-; ≥ 83 and <87, B+; ≥ 80 and <83, B; ≥ 77 and <80, B-; ≥ 73 and <77, C+; ≥ 70 and <73, C; ≥ 67 and <70, C-;  ≥ 60 and <67, D;  and less than 60 would be an F.
唯一知道grade既頭三次quiz, 三次全班既mean都係D range
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload應該是唯一的賣點
只有13個reading quiz(平均一個5題，MC)
一個小型project，簡單量量自己平時空氣exposure
還有一個final exam
沒有attendance，有人要求後有新增lecture video

reviews.author: rachel12
reviews.title: Mind-blowing course!
reviews.comment_content: Mainly about pollution! Although the title is "Urban", this course will teach us not only about the city, but also other sectors.
reviews.comment_teaching: He's really passionate about the materials. He also interacts a lot in class with the students.
reviews.comment_grading: You'll be graded from your team project, 2 quizzes (for midterm and final term exam), 3 homeworks, and participation in class
reviews.comment_workload: Manageable, 3 homeworks and 1 group project. The quizzes will be open book (you can write your own cheat sheet in 2 pages of A4 paper, either printed or handwritten is not a problem).

reviews.author: Ivana311
reviews.comment_content:
Mainly about air pollution , fun facts to be learn
need attendance and group project presentation x1
quiz x3
reviews.comment_teaching:
really good teaching. GU,Dasa is passionate in his work and research. He encourage student to ask and answer questions.
He included a site visit in UST in the course ,which is quite fun.
reviews.comment_grading:
i was so naive to get into this course when i was in my year 1 first sem :(
This course is full of international students and senior
Also,group project highly affected the grading
reviews.comment_workload: Normal. Although there were quizzes , he allow cheat sheet. However ,I don't think it is worthwhile to prepare it because u will never be able to cover the content appear in the quiz :) but formulae are important !!!

reviews.author: Aud
reviews.title: What am I studing
reviews.comment_content:
not a wise choice to choose this course
I have no idea what I have learned and I don't know what is the purpose to learn those maths...
reviews.comment_teaching:
I'm sorry prof. I skipped nearly every lesson HAHAHA
Frankly speaking, I can feel the prof has the heart to teach
reviews.comment_grading:
Assessment criteria Percentage
Homework assignment  30%
Project report 20%
Final exam 50%

In-class activities(math questionsss) are similar to assignments so if you don't know how to do the assignments, study those examples

he provides around 10 topics for the project, however, you can do your own topic if you want

didn't release the project and final score so I have no idea how's his grading (but I got a range at the end HAHA)
reviews.comment_workload:
4 assignments
1 final
1 grp prj+ presentation (can play your group's presentation video on your presentation day)+ QnA (no one asked questions so the TA had to ask lmao. TA's questions were quite difficult but luckily there was someone raised a relatively easy question after my group's presentation

since it was an online semester, a responsible leader is important

reviews.author: sn22222
reviews.title: not bad cc
reviews.comment_content:
Talks about air pollution, mix of phy chem and bio stuff. If studied science subjects in high school will have an advantage on it.

not much calculation, but need to understand the concept in order to get a good grade. Memorizing powerpoint for doing quizzes doesn't help, some questions really need to understand what's happening.
reviews.comment_teaching:
the prof accent is fair, able to hear but not too clear~

don't expect too much on it.
reviews.comment_grading:
30% Homework assignments
30% quizzes
30% group project (choose a topic by your own)
10% attendance (iprs)
reviews.comment_workload:
3 assignments short questions
2 quizzes
1 presentation 1 interim report

I would say is fair for a CC

reviews.author: syp
reviews.comment_content: Mostly about the basic concepts of urban air pollution, air quality and human health. Easy and straightforward concept.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not that interesting, but professor will answer and explain the question patiently. Have interactive teaching and some group activities.
reviews.comment_grading:
Both quizzes is not difficult, just prepare well and get everything on the cheatsheet then that's fine.
Assignment is also easy, can find most answer in the ppt and have full mark.
This course have a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
3 assignments (10% each)
2 quizzes (15% each) (can have one A4 sized cheat sheet) (multiple choice, short answer, and problem questions)
1 Group project and presentation (interim+final project) (30% in total)
participation (10%) (iPRS)
workload is quite low.

reviews.author: DHKENNY
reviews.title: Introductory course to air pollution
reviews.comment_content: Some basic concepts about urban air pollution. Factors, effects and measures. Studying chemistry in high school would be an advantage but not a must. The concepts are quite easy, just memorize it would do the job.
reviews.comment_teaching: Umm. quite bored to be honest.
reviews.comment_grading:
Three assignments 3*10%
Two quizzes (One A4 sized cheat sheet) 2*15%
Group project 30%
Participation 10%

Assignments are easy. You can get full mark as long as you are careful about it.

The first quiz is difficult as he just discussed some of the concepts in class and this didn't show in the ppt. You also need to further elaborate it. The second quiz is easy as long as you copy all the stuff to the cheat sheet but I am a lazy guy :) so I didn't get full mark.

Group project is not a big deal for me. However, my group just got a free rider who almost ruined the presentation. Try to find all the groupmates instead of letting the professor to fill the empty spot.

Class participation : Just do the iprs and you should get full mark

Me overall ~86,7/100 A
reviews.comment_workload: Low workload. Just prepare for the cheat sheet and the project.

reviews.author: mikeoxlong
reviews.title: Good grade but heavy workload
reviews.comment_content: Stuff about wind, indoor and outdoor pollutions, health impacts etc. Simple geography, physics, biology, and chemistry stuff. Really not that hard dont need to worry. Would be slightly challenging if u didnt learn science stuff in high school. Learning will be smoother if u hv science background. For the quiz u need to understand the concept PRETTY WELL in order to get above mean. Not much calculation and is simple and not very hard to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: Its alright he has passion. But no recording and lecture slides released right  before the class starts
reviews.comment_grading:
Overall grading is surprisingly good. I got everything slightly above mean  and got A-. (cutoff of A- A and A+ is very close to each other, carelessness would cost)

All quiz allow one A4 double side cheat sheet. Quiz included 5 mc and rest is short q

15% quiz 1 mean: 9.7  (me: 10) no one fullmark
-covers 1st half of lecture. The first quiz is kinda r3tarded. and cheat sheet is basically useless. 4/15 are challenging and require crystal clear understanding of the concpet to answer correctly. U wont be able to do it even if u wrote everything in the cheat sheet. U really need to understand the concept. 2/15 is straight up r3tarded. The question is about changing units. Thats it! But the unit is not used in the hw or in class and u would easily missed it! 9/15:straightforward and some  are too ez that u dont even need to look at your cheat sheet.

15% quiz 2 mean :12.3  (me: 15)
-covers the rest. Easier this time and more straightforward

All questions in hw is pretty straightforward and ez, just be careful
10% hw1 mean: 8  (me: 10)
10% hw2 mean: 9.2 (me: 10)
10% hw3 mean: 8.4 (me: 8.5)
30% project mean: 22.1 (me: mean)
- Create topic by yourself. 5 people one group. Prof really like primary data. Have presentation and Q&A
10% Attendance (score didnt release)
-iprs each class
reviews.comment_workload:
fucking horrible
16 lectures slides. Each with  around 50 pages??! There's too much shit to be covered so sometimes the prof do a speedrun. Sometimes not enough time for me to understand the concept in class so i need to email ta and ask:( No recording makes the whole thing even worse.

It takes a very long long long time to prepare the quizzes. There's simply too much stuff and u cant fit all in one A4 paper.  Everything seems so important but there is no way that u can rmb all concept so u dont know how to prepare the cheat sheet lol. Preparing the cheatsheet is the worse part of this course.

Workload of project is fine. Just choose the right topic and teammates and everything will work out just fine

reviews.author: humanbeing11111
reviews.comment_content:
fair, quite interesting
can just read through the notes by ourselves
reviews.comment_teaching: just go through the notes and powerpoint is ok for the exam
reviews.comment_grading:
no midterm, just some assignment and a final exam
got  A at last, not sure about the final paper and group project, but those homework all above mean.
reviews.comment_workload:
not much workload, just few assignments and a group project
groups are formed by ourself, topic can be choose on our own, quite interesting project and not really need technical or professional knowledge working on the project.

reviews.title: Not fun but easy go course free 3 credit course

reviews.comment_teaching: Never rlly focused on to the lecture as it was a bit boring. Sat down in class did iPRS for credit and just did other work.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not bad.
I put 0 effort and just did stuff but got above mean, so no worries on this
reviews.comment_workload:
One group presentation = easy go 3 days enough to do

Two quiz = open book quizzes (few multiple, few writing)

3 assignment = rlly easy takes like 20 min to complete

NO FINAL NO MIDTERM EXAMS

reviews.author: hlll
reviews.comment_content: Introduction about the air pollutant particles, gases, aerosols etc. Also introduced things like combustion, indoor and outdoor air pollution, measuring air pollution, human risks upon exposure to air pollution.
reviews.comment_teaching: A little bit boring, as he only needs to read the slides. Sometimes the prof overuse "discussions", and ask us to discuss on some trivial matters during lesson.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is not bad. The prof did not set the quiz/homework questions too difficult because he knows this is only a common core course. It is easy to score high marks in assignments, and the quiz is not that challenging.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not very heavy. We just got only 3 homework assignments, where you can copy most answers from the lecture slides, and some calculations included. There is only 1 quiz (originally there were 2, but because of the pandemic the prof decided to have 1 quiz only). There is also a group project where we form groups to present on an air pollution topic at our own choice.

reviews.title: Good grade but very heavy workload
reviews.comment_content:
Quite a lot. Alost everything about urban air pollution

Part 1: Exposure to Air Pollution
Part 2: Risk assessment
Part 3: Energy Use, Combustion, and Emissions
Part 4: Urban Air Quality: Transport and Transformation
reviews.comment_teaching: Both lecturers just read out the slide and copy the content of the slides onto the whiteboard
reviews.comment_grading:
Final course grades will be assigned as: ≥ 93, A+; ≥ 90 and <93, A; ≥ 87 and <90, A-; ≥ 83 and <87, B+; ≥ 80 and <83, B; ≥ 77 and <80, B-; ≥ 73 and <77, C+; ≥ 70 and <73, C; ≥ 67 and <70, C-; ≥ 60 and <67, D; and less than 60 would be an F. If everyone in the class gets 93 or higher, everyone gets an A+. There is no curve.

And I am around the mean for project, quiz and homework. And above mean for the final exam. Grade: A-

Quiz (x7): 10%
Homework (x3): 15%  
Project: 35%
Final exam: 40%
reviews.comment_workload:
Very heavy.
There are one field trip and one project that requires to come back to UST to measure air quality for 2 extra half day. Also, there are 7 quiz, which are questions about the long readings and 3 homework about content of the lectures

And the final exam is quite challenging as you have to revise for over 1000 pages of slides in one weekend

reviews.author: cyc_yin
reviews.title: 唉⋯⋯OK啦
reviews.comment_content: 講下唔同污染物，成因，佢地既解決方法，唔同技術背後原理，有時講埋廢物處理，汽車engine構造，真係學到好多野既。Prof Houng仲一時慶起帶我地去科大marine lab個邊個空氣監測站睇，又播下片、電影，係開心既。
reviews.comment_teaching: 佢個名實際係Harvey Houng洪榮勳，係台灣環保署顧問黎，幾nice，成日吹自己既威水史。佢有時講下台灣同美國個d經歷，好多互動，係學到好多野既。
reviews.comment_grading: 最初一堂Prof Houng問你expect 呢個course d咩個陣個個都答想好grade A range，但係就⋯⋯我覺得presentation個分好重要，因為我自問quiz同final都唔錯，但係presentation唔係Prof Houng覺得最有興趣同盛讚既一組，所以最後得B，好慘，我覺得自己起碼值B＋ lor。
reviews.comment_workload: quiz同final既其實要睇返熟讀返之前無咩重點既ppt，因為個D long q考你歸納同解說能力，要中point。而MC有D問題係common sense，但係有D要背返細微既野。而presentation其實係任你做返唔同geography既topic，唔局限於air pollution。

reviews.author: LTH
reviews.title: 超好grade
reviews.comment_content: 內容唔難，學吓啲air pollutants同有少少applications。計數好少，已且唔難（加減乘除）
reviews.comment_teaching: 新prof，台灣人，喺美國教過吓，nice。教得okay，但有時吹吓佢啲野。
reviews.comment_grading: 超好grade，正正常常有上堂，quiz唔差有A range。
reviews.comment_workload: 輕鬆，2 quizzes，1 present，1 final，有attendance。quiz MC＋short questions。有溫書一定識。final format同quiz一樣
